column4: No merit to report of Akamai-Google deal: source
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A report on Wednesday that Akamai Technologies Inc was close to being acquired by Google Inc is without merit  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 2-No merit to report of Akamai-Google deal-source
column5: * Akamai a long-running subject of takeover rumors-analyst

column4: Problems plague Apple iCloud  iOS launch
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Oct 13 Apple Inc rolled out its new iCloud service and latest mobile software to a chorus of user complaints this week  after glitches led to email access problems and long delays in installation.

column4: U.S. judge says Samsung tablets infringe Apple patents
column5: SAN JOSE  California A U.S. judge said Samsung's Galaxy tablets infringe Apple's iPad patents  but also that Apple might have a problem establishing the validity of its patents.

column4: UPDATE 2-Apple's iPhone 4S goes on sale  fans say tribute to Jobs
column5: * Hundreds of Australians start global rush to buy iPhone 4S

column4: Apple's iPhone 4S goes on sale  fans say tribute to Jobs
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 14 Apple Inc's iPhone 4S finally hit stores around the globe on Friday  with fans expected to snap up the final gadget unveiled during Steve Jobs' lifetime  many buying the phone as a tribute to the former Apple boss.

column5: Oct 13 Apple Inc's fifth-generation iPhone uses chips from Qualcomm Inc   Toshiba  and a host of smaller semiconductor companies  according to repair firm iFixit  which cracked the device open on Thursday.

column4: BlackBerry outages irk India  threaten key RIM market
column5: NEW DELHI/MUMBAI A four-day service outage has cast a shadow over BlackBerry's reputation in India  one of the smartphone maker's few growing markets  where the frustration of hundreds of thousands of users could mean a chance for its rivals to gain ground.

column4: Apple iPhone 4S features Qualcomm chip
column5: Apple Inc's fifth-generation iPhone uses a wireless chipset from Qualcomm Inc as well as silicon from smaller chipmakers  according to repair and parts specialist iFixit  which cracked the device open on Thursday.

column4: Nikkei climbs to 1-month high on euro zone hopes
column5: TOKYO Japan's Nikkei stock average rose to a 1-month high Thursday on expectations that Europe will come up with measures to shore up its banks  with chip-related stocks climbing on a boost in sales for ASML Holding NV.

column4: Nikkei climbs to 1-month high on euro zone hopes
column5: TOKYO  Oct 13 Japan's Nikkei stock average rose to a 1-month high on Thursday on expectations that Europe will come up with measures to shore up its banks  with chip-related stocks climbing on a boost in sales for ASML Holding.     	     The Nikkei benchmark climbed 1 percent to 8 823.25  while the broader Topix index advanced 0.7 percent to 758.83.

column5: * Benchmark solidly above 25-day moving average     * Exporters gain as yen falls to one-month low     * ASML sales lift chip-related shares      By Lisa Twaronite	     TOKYO  Oct 13 Japan's Nikkei stock average rose to a four-week high on Thursday on expectations that Europe will come up with actual measures to support Greece and shore up European banks.    	     Semiconductor-related shares gained after Dutch chip equipment firm ASML Holding NV reported better-than-expected quarter

column4: TEXT-Fitch lowers UK support rtng floors; cuts Lloyds  RBS to 'A'
column5: Oct 13- Fitch Ratings has lowered its Support Rating Floors (SRF) for systemically important UK banks to 'A' from 'AA-' and 'A+'. As a result  Lloyds Banking Group plc's (LBG) and Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc's (RBSG) Long-term Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) have been downgraded to 'A' from 'AA-'. Separately  Fitch has also placed Barclays plc's IDR and Viability Rating (VR) on Rating Watch Negative (RWN). A full list of rating actions is at the end of this comment.

column4: UPDATE 1-GSI Tech cuts outlook as sales to Cisco dip
column5: Oct 13 GSI Technology Inc trimmed its second-quarter revenue outlook hurt by lower sales to its largest client Cisco Systems and softness in demand from its Asian customers.

column4: Cisco  USAID sign $50 mln Russia partnership deal
column5: Oct 13 Networking giant Cisco Systems  and USAID have signed a deal under which they will fund up to $50 million of initiatives to boost the use of IT by government and civilians in Russia.

column4: Hulu taken off the block
column5: The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

column5: Oct 13 The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

column4: Buyout talks in focus as Sony Ericsson seen posting Q3 profit
column5: STOCKHOLM Reports that Sony could take control of Sony Ericsson are likely to overshadow the handset maker's third-quarter results on Friday  when it is expected to show that a beefed-up smartphone line helped it to make a small profit.

column4: UPDATE 2-JB Hunt reports higher Q3 profit  shares up
column5: Oct 13 J.B. Hunt Transport Services  reported higher quarterly profit that slightly beat Wall Street estimates  driven by double-digit revenue growth in three of its four divisions.

column4: UPDATE 1-Kforce raises Q3 outlook above estimates
column5: Oct 13 Staffing company Kforce Inc  raised its third-quarter outlook amid a rise in temporary hiring.

column4: UPDATE 1-Microchip cuts Q2 outlook on soft demand
column5: Oct 13 Microchip Technology Inc  forecast disappointing July-September results  saying its business did not pick up towards the end of the quarter as it had hoped  as a weak economy squeezes demand in the chipmaking industry.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 2-Romney sharpens attack on China's economic policies
column5: SEATTLE  Oct 13 U.S. Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney on Thursday threatened trade sanctions against China if the world's No. 2 economy does not halt what he said was currency manipulation  unfair subsidies and rampant intellectual property theft.

column4: Netflix gets more shows from CBS  Warner Bros
column5: Oct 13 Netflix Inc's U.S customers will be able to watch shows like "Gossip Girl" and "The Vampire Diaries" online after it signed programming deals with CBS Corp and Warner Bros for shows from their joint venture  The CW television network.

column4: UPDATE 1-Hulu taken off the block
column5: Oct 13 The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

column4: UPDATE 1-Hulu taken off the block
column5: Oct 13 The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

column4: UK cost agency rejects Bristol-Myers' skin cancer drug
column5: * Melanoma treatment Yervoy costs around 80 000 pounds a patient

column4: RPC Inc shares rise on buyout rumors
column5: Oct 13 Shares of oilfield service company RPC Inc jumped as much as 11 percent on rumors of a possible buyout by onshore driller Patterson-UTI Energy Inc .

column4: UPDATE 3-Apple's new iPhone features Qualcomm  Toshiba
column5: Oct 13 Apple Inc's fifth-generation iPhone uses chips from Qualcomm Inc   Toshiba  and a host of smaller semiconductor companies  according to repair firm iFixit  which cracked the device open on Thursday.

column4: JPMorgan drags blue chips down; Google up late
column5: NEW YORK The Dow and S&P 500 slipped on Thursday after JPMorgan's earnings and China's soft trade data revived worries about the impact of slower growth on profits. | Video

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-S&P briefly turns up
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 13 The S&P 500 briefly turned higher and the Dow cut losses on Thursday  with technology leading the way up. The Nasdaq added to gains.

column4: REFILE-US STOCKS-Dow  S&P 500 slip as JPMorgan falls; Nasdaq up
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 13 The Dow and S&P 500 slipped on Thursday as JPMorgan's earnings and China's soft economic data increased worries about the impact of slower growth on third-quarter profits.

column4: US STOCKS-JP Morgan results splash water on Wall St's 3-day rise
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 13 U.S. stocks fell on Thursday after three days of gains as earnings from JPMorgan and soft economic data from China reinforced worries about a slowing global economy.

column4: US STOCKS-JP Morgan results splash water on Wall St's 3-day rise
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 13 U.S. stocks fell on Thursday after three days of gains as earnings from JPMorgan and soft economic data from China reinforced worries about a slowing global economy.

column4: UPDATE 1-IMS revises Incivek drug data; Vertex shares jump
column5: Oct. 13 IMS Health  which provides prescription data and other services to the pharmaceutical industry  said it is revising estimates of the number of prescriptions written in late September for Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc's  hepatitis C drug Incivek  sending its shares up nearly 7 percent.

column4: UPDATE 2-Blame game looms over BlackBerry email delays
column5: Oct 13 BlackBerry maker Research In Motion  faced the prospect of a compensation bill from network providers on Thursday as it wrestled for a fourth day to get the world's dominant mobile email service working properly.

column4: UPDATE 1-Compensation clouds gather over BlackBerry outage
column5: Oct 13 BlackBerry maker Research In Motion  faced the prospect of a compensation bill from network providers on Thursday as the world's dominant provider of mobile email struggled for a fourth day with service glitches.

column4: EURO GOVT-Bunds hit session high before Italian auctions
column5: LONDON  Oct 13 German Bund futures reversed losses to hit the day's highs on Thursday as Italian bond yields rose to their highest in more than two months ahead of BTP auctions seen testing investor demand after Moody's and Fitch cut Italy's ratings last week.

column4: UPDATE 2-Canada approves LNG exports for Apache-led project
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Oct 13 Canada's National Energy Board gave the go-ahead on Thursday for the country's first exports of liquefied natural gas  approving a license sought by KM LNG  a group  led by Apache Corp   planning an LNG project on the Pacific Coast.

column4: TEXT: S&P Places AGM Corp-Insured U.S. Pub Fin Iss Rtgs On Watch Neg
column5: NEW YORK (Standard & Poor's) Oct. 13  2011--Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today it placed its ratings on 610 Assured Guaranty Municipal Corp.-  152 Assured Guaranty Corp.-  and eight Assured Guaranty Municipal Corp.- and Assured Guaranty Corp.-insured U.S. Public Finance issues on CreditWatch with negative implications.

column4: FCC presses AT&T on jobs claims for merger
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 A federal telecommunications regulator asked AT&T Inc on Thursday to provide data on claims that its deal to buy T-Mobile USA would mean a net gain of U.S. jobs  saying its responses on this issue "remain incomplete."

column4: MetroPCS says uniquely placed for Clearwire deal
column5: NEW YORK MetroPCS Communications Inc  sees itself as "uniquely positioned" to forge a spectrum deal with Clearwire Corp .

column4: TEX-S&P cuts 16 Banco Santander LOC-supported rtgs
column5: Oct 13 - Standard & Poor's Ratings Services today lowered its ratings on 16 bond issues that are supported by Banco Santander S.A.'s confirming letters of credit (LOCs) to 'AA-/A-1+' from 'AA/A-1+' (see list). The long-term components of our ratings on the bonds are based on the higher of our long-term issuer credit ratings on Sovereign Bank ('A')  the fronting LOC provider  and Banco Santander S.A. ('AA-')  the confirming LOC provider (collectively  the LOC providers) and address full and timel

column4: UPDATE 1-Democrats ask US Justice Dept to probe bank fees
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 House Democrats on Thursday called on the Justice Department to investigate whether large banks are coordinating new fees in violation of antitrust laws.

column4: Chicago protesters stage "die-in" at bank
column5: CHICAGO A few hundred demonstrators protesting over unemployment woes targeted Bank of America on Thursday  with 30 protesters entering a bank building in Chicago and laying down in a "die-in" before heeding police orders to leave.

column4: UPDATE 1-BofA names MacDonald head of equities  Asia-Pacific - memo
column5: HONG KONG  Oct 13 Bank of America Corp (BofA)  has named Peter MacDonald as the head of its equities business for the Asia-Pacific  according to an internal memo seen by Reuters  a move that aligns BofA's Asian business with the global structure.

column5: Barclays Capital analysts picked Telefonica Brasil as their top stock among Latin American telecoms  starting coverage on the company and rival Brazilian carrier TIM Participacoes with an "overweight" rating. column4: TEXT-Fitch lowers UK support rtng floors; cuts Lloyds  RBS to 'A'
column5: Oct 13- Fitch Ratings has lowered its Support Rating Floors (SRF) for systemically important UK banks to 'A' from 'AA-' and 'A+'. As a result  Lloyds Banking Group plc's (LBG) and Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc's (RBSG) Long-term Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) have been downgraded to 'A' from 'AA-'. Separately  Fitch has also placed Barclays plc's IDR and Viability Rating (VR) on Rating Watch Negative (RWN). A full list of rating actions is at the end of this comment.

column5: * Reserve downsized as DOE converts to ultra-clean diesel     * DOE ends leasing of storage space in NY Harbor      WASHINGTON  Oct 13 The U.S. Department of Energy said on Thursday it will halve the home heating oil reserve to 1 million barrels of fuel as supplies near the New York harbor are adequate.     The heating oil reserve is being converted to hold ultra-low-sulfur diesel because several states in the Northeast will require the use of cleaner fuels in coming years.     The D

column4: U.S. DOE halves home heat oil reserve to 1 mln bbls
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 The U.S. Department of Energy said on Thursday it will halve the home heating oil reserve to 1 million barrels of fuel as supplies near the New York harbor are adequate. column5: SEOUL  Oct 13 South Korea's POSCO  has decided to slash capital expenditure this year by about 1 trillion won ($857 million)  as steel markets shrink amid the global economic slowdown  local media reported on Thursday.

column4: TEXT-S&P: AIG Edison Life upgraded to 'AA-';outlook negative
column5: -- The Prudential Financial group announced that three companies under its umbrella--AIG Edison  AIG Star  and Gibraltar--have signed a merger agreement. (Gibraltar will be the surviving entity.)

column4: UPDATE 3-Rio Tinto defies gloom with record iron ore sales
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 13 Mining giant Rio Tinto   sought to brush off fears of a global economic crisis on Thursday  reporting record iron ore sales and a 5 percent jump in output for the third quarter  predicting continued strong commodities demand.

column4: UPDATE 2-China's Sept iron ore imports highest since January
column5: SHANGHAI/SINGAPORE  Oct 13 China imported 60.57 million tonnes of iron ore in September  the highest monthly volume since January  as mills stocked up ahead of a holiday  but the purchasing momentum of the world's top buyer may not be sustained as steel prices take a hit.

column4: Rio Tinto Q3 iron ore output +5 pct vs yr ago
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 13 Global miner Rio Tinto   on Thursday reported a 5 percent rise in third-quarter iron ore production from a year ago and said its Australian coal operations had recovered from flooding earlier in the year.

column4: TEXT-Fitch lowers UK support rtng floors; cuts Lloyds  RBS to 'A'
column5: Oct 13- Fitch Ratings has lowered its Support Rating Floors (SRF) for systemically important UK banks to 'A' from 'AA-' and 'A+'. As a result  Lloyds Banking Group plc's (LBG) and Royal Bank of Scotland Group plc's (RBSG) Long-term Issuer Default Ratings (IDR) have been downgraded to 'A' from 'AA-'. Separately  Fitch has also placed Barclays plc's IDR and Viability Rating (VR) on Rating Watch Negative (RWN). A full list of rating actions is at the end of this comment.

column4: RPC Inc shares rise on buyout rumors
column5: Oct 13 Shares of oilfield service company RPC Inc jumped as much as 11 percent on rumors of a possible buyout by onshore driller Patterson-UTI Energy Inc .

column4: Nikkei hits 4-week high on euro zone hopes
column5: * Benchmark solidly above 25-day moving average     * Exporters gain  lifted as yen falls to one-month low      By Lisa Twaronite	     TOKYO  Oct 13 Japan's Nikkei rose to a four-week high on Thursday on hopes that Europe will come up with actual measures to support Greece and shore up European banks.    	     Shares in major exporters such as Sony Corp   which were sold off during the market downturn until earlier this month on worries about the global economy  rose sharply as playe

column4: Clearwire rallies on subs growth  MetroPCS deal talk
column5: NEW YORK Clearwire Corp reported  better-than-expected subscriber numbers on Thursday  while MetroPCS Communications  said it is interested in spectrum deal with the wireless telecommunications company.

column4: UPDATE 4-Clearwire rallies on subs growth  MetroPCS deal talk
column5: * Sees cash at $700 mln  better than analyst expectations

column4: Norway's Troll A gas flowing at 33 pct capacity
column5: TROLL A PLATFORM  North Sea - Oct 13 Norway's Troll A natural gas platform is running at a third of capacity  or 40 million cubic metres per day  operator Statoil  said on Thursday.

column4: FDA reviewers unconvinced on Teva Parkinson's drug
column5: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's clinical trials of its Parkinson's drug Azilect left U.S. drug reviewers unconvinced that the treatment slows the disease's progression.

column4: UPDATE 2-FDA reviewers unconvinced on Teva Parkinson's drug
column5: Oct 13 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's  clinical trials of its Parkinson's drug Azilect left U.S. drug reviewers unconvinced that the treatment slows the disease's progression.

column4: JPM results signal tough quarter for private equity
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 13 A loss at JPMorgan Chase & Co's private equity group signals a tough quarter for buyout shops  as global economic uncertainty and market declines hit the value of their investments.

column4: Lawmakers say pipeline approval process tainted
column5: WASHINGTON/CALGARY U.S. lawmakers will urge Secretary of State Hillary Clinton on Friday to reject the proposed route of the Keystone XL oil sands pipeline  saying they are concerned the approval process has been tainted by alleged conflicts of interest.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-US to impose sanctions on BP  Gulf spill contractors
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 12 The U.S. offshore drilling regulator on Wednesday formally issued sanctions against BP  and the major contractors involved in the 2010 explosion on the Deepwater Horizon rig that killed 11 workers and spewed more than 4 million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico.

column4: U.S. to impose sanctions on BP  Gulf spill contractors
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. offshore drilling regulator on Wednesday formally issued sanctions against BP and the major contractors involved in the 2010 explosion on the Deepwater Horizon rig that killed 11 workers and spewed more than 4 million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico.

column4: UPDATE 2-Turkcell fails to hold key votes at EGM
column5: * EGM fails to vote on dividend   (Adds analyst comment  share reaction)

column4: Turkcell shares fall 1.4 pct after EGM fails to hold key votes
column5: ISTANBUL  Oct 13 Shares in Turkey's biggest mobile operator Turkcell fell 1.4 percent on Thursday after its extraordinary general meeting failed to hold key votes on board changes and dividend distribution late on Wednesday.

column4: Turkcell says EGM did not vote on dividend distribution
column5: ISTANBUL  Oct 13 An extraordinary general meeting of Turkcell   Turkey's biggest cell network operator  did not vote on its dividend distribution  the company said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Valmont Q3 tops; flags Europe slowdown concerns
column5: Oct 13 Valmont Industries Inc posted quarterly results that topped market estimates on higher sales at its irrigation segment but warned that the economic slowdown  particularly in Europe  could hurt its business in the current quarter.

column4: ATM group sues Visa  MasterCard over price fixing
column5: A group representing operators of automated teller machines filed a lawsuit against Visa  and MasterCard  alleging that the credit and debit card issuers violated antitrust laws by fixing the price of ATM access fees.

column4: INSIGHT-Wal-Mart moms: The election pollsters' new favorites
column5: Oct 13 Laura Bartlett doesn't think of herself as the key to the 2012 elections. She's a bank employee  mother of two and budding comedian with the troupe Four Funny Females. And honestly  she couldn't care less about politics.

column4: UPDATE 1-Hulu taken off the block
column5: Oct 13 The joint owners of Hulu  said they have decided against a sale of the popular online video service amid rumors that the bids received were lower than they were willing to accept.

column4: UPDATE 1-Democrats ask US Justice Dept to probe bank fees
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 House Democrats on Thursday called on the Justice Department to investigate whether large banks are coordinating new fees in violation of antitrust laws.

column4: Wells Fargo gives staff tough healthcare choices
column5: Wells Fargo & Co plans to cut costs by moving its workers into insurance plans that encourage them to spend less on healthcare.

column4: Eleven arrested in San Francisco protest
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Police arrested 11 demonstrators for blocking access to Wells Fargo's corporate headquarters in San Francisco on Wednesday  and the city's famed cable cars were halted for two hours during protests against economic inequality  officials said. | Video

column4: Whiting Petroleum awaits N Dakota ok for pipeline
column5: Oct 13  Independent oil producer Whiting Petroleum Corp is awaiting state permission for construction of crude pipeline to replace trucks as a means of access to major crude markets for the growing amount of shale oil from its North Dakota Bakken fields  a state regulator said on Thursday.

column4: Winnebago warns of rough ride ahead
column5: Winnebago Industries Inc's  profit topped Wall Street estimates  but hopes of a nascent recovery in the recreational vehicle industry earlier this year skidded as the largest U.S. motor home maker warned of ebbing consumer confidence.

column5: * Company considering price reductions in 2012 - CEO   By A. Ananthalakshmi and Lynn Adler	 Oct 13 Winnebago Industries Inc's profit topped Wall Street estimates  but hopes of a nascent recovery in the recreational vehicle industry earlier this year skidded as the largest U.S. motor home maker warned of ebbing consumer confidence.
